channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Artificial intelligence meets human creativity
item.description: Circa 1450, the creative community was jolted. The printing press had just been invented in Europe. Scribes, typically monks who had spent lifetimes p...

item.title: Your leadership signature matters
item.description: We’re living through a seismic workforce disruption. Business leaders are poised to have a significant impact on the way our economy is shaped over th...

item.title: Why an ASEAN power grid is key to tapping Southeast Asia’s green potential
item.description: A regional grid may be pricy, but it can help export green power where it needs to go—and boost regional cooperation too.

item.title: General Motors Just Lost Its Chief AI Officer After Only 8 Months
item.description: Barak Turovsky announced on his LinkedIn that he was leaving the newly created position, sparking concern over a slate of departures in recent months.

item.title: Americans can’t agree on what ‘middle class’ means anymore, and they’re debating it in the comments of TikTok home tours
item.description: The “average” or “normal” home tour is fascinating, even dividing, thousands of Americans on TikTok who can’t agree on social class.

item.title: ‘Low-hire, low-fire’ economy grinds on as lower-than-expected jobless claims suggests layoffs aren’t spiking
item.description: U.S. applications for unemployment benefits in the week ending Nov. 22 dropped 6,000 from the previous week to 216,000, the Labor Department reported.

item.title: Your company’s AI strategy is backward
item.description: Enterprises across the globe are pouring an estimated $1.5 trillion into artificial intelligence , and the results are already significant: AI has add...

item.title: Why Gen-Z Is Obsessed With the Quarter Zip
item.description: ​​Over the past few weeks, FYPs have become dominated by the workwear staple. The style sends a certain signal at work.

item.title: The Special Test That Helps One Company Identify Gay Sheep
item.description: What happens when your business model depends on gay sheep? You have to get innovative.

item.title: Uncle Nearest Distillery Makes New Move in Fight Against Receivership
item.description: The company faces an uncertain future in an industry facing declining sales.

item.title: Supreme Court to hear Texas landlord’s lawsuit against the Post Office for failing to deliver mail for 2 years
item.description: The DOJ argued that if the landlord wins, people will infer mail didn’t arrive “because of a rude comment that they heard, or what have you.”

item.title: Menopause at work is an equity issue
item.description: Let’s be honest: When we talk about workplace equity, menopause rarely makes the agenda. But it should. This life stage impacts half the workforce, of...

item.title: What to Know About Michael Burry’s Beef With Nvidia
item.description: The two sides have exchanged words as rivals circle.

item.title: Campbell’s fires exec after leaked recording berating ‘poor’ customers and ‘bioengineered meat’ prompts outrage and investigation
item.description: The comments were caught on a recording by a now-former employee.

item.title: MIT study finds AI is already capable of replacing 11.7% of U.S. workers
item.description: A new study from MIT shows that AI might be poised to replace a lot more jobs than previously forecast. According to researchers, a hidden mass of dat...
